page.title: 09HONING E.RUSTON HOUSING
page.content: Most homes are brick built. In the villages are semi-detached council houses,a few terraced rows of small houses,and larger detached homes, some converted from former shops or public houses, and privately owned.In the surrounding countryside are some large farmhouses,a mansion and three rectories no longer inhabited by clergy.Many of the houses are connected with farming.Flint is a local building material, used either as whole stones,knapped into square shapes or cut so as to present a flat, shining surface called dressing. There are many cottages made of flint or flint and brick. These were often 'tied' cottages that went with a farmworker's job. If he lost his job he also lost his home. The law does not allow this to happen now.
